As I am writing, January 8 2026, it has passed 25 years since the first publication of ‚ÄúData Science: An Action Plan for Expanding the Technical Areas of the Field of Statistics‚Äù. This paper, as David Donoho pointed out, may be the earliest and clearest mention to Data Science as a new field for addressing the emphasis on theory given by most of the statisticians. In the last years, a new question that may pose now may be whether being a Data Scientist is still relevant given the rise of ML Engineering roles, with many of the promoters of such conversations stating, ‚ÄúNobody cares anymore about a professional that simply runs notebooks‚Äù. Clearly, such statements are not well received by those acquainted
